required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Trial With Zoledronic Acid for the Treatment of Paget's Disease of Bone, Including an Extended Observation Period
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Safety and Efficacy Trial With Intravenous Zoledronic Acid for the Treatment of Paget's Disease of Bone Using Risedronate as a Comparator, Including an Extended Observation Period

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this core study was to show non-inferiority of zoledronic acid to risedronate, with respect to the proportion of patients who achieved therapeutic response. The extended observation period included participants of the core study who responded to treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Had Therapeutic Response at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: A therapeutic response was defined as a reduction of at least 75% from baseline (Visit 1) in serum alkaline phosphatase (SAP) excess (difference between measured level and midpoint to the normal range) or normalization of SAP at the end of six months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Change in Serum Alkaline Phosphatase in U/L at Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: The percent change in serum alkaline phosphatase from baseline to Day 28 was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Change in Serum C-telopeptide (CTx) in ng/mL at Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: The percent change in serum C-telopeptide from baseline to Day 10 was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Change in Urine α-CTx in ug/mmol at Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: The percent change in urine α-CTx from baseline to Day 10 was measured.

Therapeutic response was defined as a reduction of at least 75% from baseline in serum alkaline phosphatase excess (difference between measured level and midpoint to the normal range) or normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Achieved Serum Alkaline Phosphatase Normalization at Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase occurred if the serum alkaline phosphatase measurement fell within the normal range. Central laboratory reference ranges for serum alkaline phosphatase: 31-110 U/L (female & male 20-58 years) and 35-115 U/L (female & male >58 years).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Severity at Day 182
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain severity score from Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF). This scale values are 0 to 10, a lower score means little to no pain while a higher score means greater pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Interference at Day 182
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain interference score from Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF). This scale values are 0 to 10, a lower score means little to no pain while a higher score means greater pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Loss of Therapeutic Response During the Extended Observation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Extended observation period. A therapeutic response is defined as a reduction of at least 75% from baseline in serum alkaline phosphatase excess or normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Partial Disease Relapse During the Extended Observation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Extended observation period. A partial disease relapse was defined as an increase in serum alkaline phosphatase >= 50% from the serum alkaline phosphatase measurement at Month 6 and at least 1.25 times the upper normal limit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Disease Relapse During the Extended Observation Period
secondary_outcome.description: Extended observation period. A disease relapse was defined as the occurrence of a serum alkaline phosphatase level that was >= 80% of baseline serum alkaline phosphatase value.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Zoledronic acid and placebo to risedronate
arm_group.description: Participants received zoledronic acid 5.0 mg i.v. infusion one dose, 60 days of oral placebo to risedronate, calcium 500mg bid and vitamin D 400 to 1000 IU daily during the core period, and received only calcium and vitamin D supplements during the extended observation period.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Risedronate and placebo to zoledronic acid
arm_group.description: Participants received 60 days of oral risedronate 30 mg, one i.v. infusion of placebo to zoledronic acid infusion, calcium 500mg bid and vitamin d 400 to 1000 IU daily during the core period, and received only calcium and vitamin D supplements during the extended observation period.

intervention.description: 5 mg zoledronic acid in 5 mL of sterile water for infusion
intervention.arm_group_label: Zoledronic acid and placebo to risedronate

intervention.description: 5 mL of sterile water for infusion
intervention.arm_group_label: Risedronate and placebo to zoledronic acid

intervention.description: 30mg oral tablets overencapsulated to match the placebo capsules
intervention.arm_group_label: Risedronate and placebo to zoledronic acid
Zoledronic acid and placebo to risedronate

intervention.description: Calcium and vitamin D supplements were supplied
intervention.arm_group_label: Zoledronic acid and placebo to risedronate
Risedronate and placebo to zoledronic acid

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 30 years or older
- SAP 2 times ULN
- Confirmed diagnosis of Paget's disease of the bone (by x-ray, magnetic resonance imaging, computerized tomography, radioisotope imaging, etc.).
- 90 days washout calcitonin
- 180 day washout bisphosphonate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergic reaction to bisphosphonates
- History of upper GI disorders
- History of iritis, uveitis
- Calculated creatinine clearance < 30 ml/min at baseline
- Evidence of vitamin D deficiency
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

clinical_study.keyword: Zoledronic acid, risedronate, Paget's disease of bone

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 371 patients were screened. 185 patients were randomized.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid and Placebo to Risedronate
group.description: Participants received zoledronic acid 5.0 mg i.v. infusion one dose, 60 days of oral placebo to risedronate, calcium 500mg bid and vitamin D 400 to 1000 IU daily during the core period, and received only calcium and vitamin D supplements during the extended observation period.

group.title: Risedronate and Placebo to Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Participants received 60 days of oral risedronate 30 mg, one i.v. infusion of placebo to zoledronic acid infusion, calcium 500mg bid and vitamin d 400 to 1000 IU daily during the core period, and received only calcium and vitamin D supplements during the extended observation period.

participants_list.participants: Includes patients retreated for Paget's disease and patients discontinued when sponsor ended study
Includes patients retreated for Paget's disease and patients discontinued when sponsor ended study

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Patients Who Had Therapeutic Response at 6 Months
outcome.description: A therapeutic response was defined as a reduction of at least 75% from baseline (Visit 1) in serum alkaline phosphatase (SAP) excess (difference between measured level and midpoint to the normal range) or normalization of SAP at the end of six months.
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat population: all randomized patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline serum alkaline phosphatase measurement. Missing values at 6 months were imputed using the last post-baseline measurement prior to 6 months.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid and Placebo to Risedronate

measure.population: Modified intent to treat population: all randomized patients with both baseline and at least one post-baseline serum alkaline phosphatase measurement. Missing values at 6 months were imputed using the last post-baseline measurement prior to 6 months.

outcome.description: Change in pain severity score from Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF). This scale values are 0 to 10, a lower score means little to no pain while a higher score means greater pain.

reported_events.desc: The safety population consisted of all randomized patients who were exposed to study drug.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: Participants received zoledronic acid 5.0 mg i.v. infusion one dose, 60 days of oral placebo to risedronate, calcium 500mg bid and vitamin D 400 to 1000 IU daily during the core period, and received only calcium and vitamin D supplements during the extended observation period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
